org.pikater.core.utilities.evolution

Class EvolutionaryAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.core.utilities.evolution.EvolutionaryAlgorithm

  • public class EvolutionaryAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class which is responsible for the run of a single generation of the evolutionary algorithm. Provides a way to specify the fitness function, operators, and selectors used during the evolution. Also the size of the elite can be specified.
    Author:
    Martin Pilat

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EvolutionaryAlgorithm()
      Initializes an empty evolutionary algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EvolutionaryAlgorithm

        public EvolutionaryAlgorithm()
        Initializes an empty evolutionary algorithm. Replacement is set to the instance of SGAReplacement. All other values remain unset.

    • Method Detail

      • setReplacement

        public void setReplacement(Replacement replacement)
        Setter for the replacement.
        Parameters:
        replacement - The replacement which shall be used.

      • setElite

        public void setElite(double elitePercentage)
        Specifies the size of the elite which shall be used.
        Parameters:
        elitePercentage - The percentage of population which shall be used as elite. Should be number between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).

      • addOperator

        public void addOperator(Operator o)
        Adds a new genetic operator to the queue of genetic operators.
        Parameters:
        o - The operator which should be added.

      • addMatingSelector

        public void addMatingSelector(Selector s)
        Adds a new mating selector the the queue of mating selectors.
        Parameters:
        s - The selector which shall be added.

      • addEnvironmentalSelector

        public void addEnvironmentalSelector(Selector s)
        Adds a new environmental sector to the queue of environmental selectors.
        Parameters:
        s - The environmental selector which shall be added.

      • setFitnessFunction

        public void setFitnessFunction(FitnessFunction f)
        Sets the fitness function which is maximized by the evolutionary algoritm. Internally this method creates an instance of SimpleEvaluater which is used the evaluate the whole population.
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function which shall be used.

      • setFitnessEvaluator

        public void setFitnessEvaluator(FitnessEvaluator fe)
        Sets the fitness evaluator which evaluates the whole population at once. This allows to assign fitness to individuals even if the fitness of particular individual depends on the fitness of other individuals in the population.
        Parameters:
        fe - The fitness evaluator which shall be used. Must assign fitness to all individuals in the population.

      • evolve

        public void evolve(Population pop)
        Executes one generation of the evolutionary algorithm. First, the mating selectors are used to create the mating pool. In this step, if there are n mating selectors, each of them selects 1/n of the population. The last specified selector may select more individuals to make the population size constant. Next, the specified operators are executed in the order they were specified. The population generated by an operator is used as the input for the next operator in the queue. Then, the selection starts. First, the specified number of elite individuals is added to the population of selected individuals. Then the parent and offspring populations are combined using the replacement specified and environmental selections are executed to select individuals from the combined population. The process is similar to the one used for mating selectors. Finally, the individuals in the input population are replaced by the newly selected individuals.
        Parameters:
        pop - The population on which the single generation shall be run.
